ci_support_linux_64_.yaml:
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
python_min:
- '3.10'

about.description:
pyCoreRelator is a Python package designed for quantitative stratigraphic correlation
analysis across geological core and physical log data. It provides tools for processing
RGB and CT core images, data gap filling using machine learning, interactive stratigraphic
boundary picking, and Dynamic Time Warping (DTW) based correlation analysis.

Key Features:
- RGB and CT image processing for geological cores
- Machine learning-based data gap filling
- Interactive stratigraphic boundary picking
- DTW-based core correlation with age constraints
- Synthetic stratigraphy generation for null hypothesis testing
about.summary: A package for quantitative stratigraphic correlation across geological core and physical log data

about.description:
pyCoreRelator is a Python package designed for quantitative stratigraphic correlation
analysis across geological core and physical log data. It provides tools for processing
RGB and CT core images, data gap filling using machine learning, interactive stratigraphic
boundary picking, and Dynamic Time Warping (DTW) based correlation analysis.

Key Features:
- RGB and CT image processing for geological cores
- Machine learning-based data gap filling
- Interactive stratigraphic boundary picking
- DTW-based core correlation with age constraints
- Synthetic stratigraphy generation for null hypothesis testing
about.summary: A package for quantitative stratigraphic correlation across geological core and physical log data

name: pycorerelator
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "pycorerelator" %}
{% set version = "0.0.1" %}

package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://pypi.org/packages/source/{{ name[0] }}/{{ name }}/pycorerelator-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: d61f6f4c345eac326db7a6299b639cd1e4e6d9ed7494d51f8fb89a3f9c162e38

build:
  noarch: python
  script: {{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . -vv
  number: 0

requirements:
  host:
    - python {{ python_min }}
    - pip
    - setuptools >=45
    - wheel
  run:
    - python >={{ python_min }}
    - numpy >=1.20.0
    - pandas >=1.3.0
    - scipy >=1.7.0
    - matplotlib-base >=3.5.0
    - pillow >=8.3.0
    - imageio >=2.9.0
    - librosa >=0.9.0
    - tqdm >=4.60.0
    - joblib >=1.1.0
    - ipython >=7.25.0
    - psutil >=5.8.0
    - pydicom >=2.3.0
    - py-opencv >=4.5.0
    - scikit-learn >=1.0.0
    - xgboost >=1.6.0
    - lightgbm >=3.3.0

test:
  imports:
    - pyCoreRelator
    - pyCoreRelator.preprocessing
    - pyCoreRelator.analysis
    - pyCoreRelator.utils
  commands:
    - pip check
  requires:
    - python {{ python_min }}
    - pip

about:
  home: https://github.com/GeoLarryLai/pyCoreRelator
  summary: A package for quantitative stratigraphic correlation across geological core and physical log data
  description: |
    pyCoreRelator is a Python package designed for quantitative stratigraphic correlation 
    analysis across geological core and physical log data. It provides tools for processing 
    RGB and CT core images, data gap filling using machine learning, interactive stratigraphic 
    boundary picking, and Dynamic Time Warping (DTW) based correlation analysis.
    
    Key Features:
    - RGB and CT image processing for geological cores
    - Machine learning-based data gap filling
    - Interactive stratigraphic boundary picking
    - DTW-based core correlation with age constraints
    - Synthetic stratigraphy generation for null hypothesis testing
  license: AGPL-3.0-or-later
  license_file: LICENSE
  doc_url: https://github.com/GeoLarryLai/pyCoreRelator/blob/main/FUNCTION_DOCUMENTATION.md
  dev_url: https://github.com/GeoLarryLai/pyCoreRelator

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - GeoLarryLai
